skills.about: I have been working in design since 2009, initially creating layouts for newspapers and books. Since 2011, I have been engaged in commercial design, working in publishing houses and printing houses. Since 2014, I have been involved in digital product design, layout, and front-end development. I represent two competencies in teams - as a designer and front-end developer.

design.title: Design
design.description: Interface prototyping based on hypotheses and analysis of user experience. Hypothesis generation based on user data from analytics services. Designing scenarios for user interaction with the product. Creating and maintaining a library of components and design tokens as part of a design system. Writing text for interfaces in an informative style that is consistent with the product's tone of voice.

dev.description: Setting up and integrating Headless CMS into a project. Configuring infrastructure for local development and running the project on VPS in Docker. Configuring internal and external routing, including SSL. Setting up CI/CD (drone.io) and project builds.

matrix.description:
«To understand the current capabilities of the team as a whole, it is necessary to assess the specific skills of each designer (such as interface animation or expert evaluation)»
Yuri Vetrov on interfaces

1.title: Awareness
1.description: Understanding how a specialist works in this field, what tasks they perform, their workflow and tools, methods and practices, what peculiarities and limitations are imposed on them.

2.title: Skill
2.description: The ability to solve basic tasks in the field, such as completing less critical parts of work under the guidance of a lead specialist, assembling a layout or prototype based on existing materials, making meaningful improvements to an existing document, etc.

3.title: Expertise
3.description: Performing most tasks in the field of knowledge from start to finish, often independently. Ability to handle atypical situations.

4.title: Leadership
4.description: The ability to transfer expertise to other team members, assist in training and professional growth of colleagues, develop tools and methods, and enhance overall design culture. The opportunity to identify problematic situations in the project or process and assist in their resolution.
